result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis Lidell Chalmers

records.addlTxt:
ORDER FOR COMPENSATION FOR AN INVESTIGATOR; signed and filed.

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that payment for a private investigator of up to $400.00 is approved.
Petition Directing Compensation for Investigator; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Clerk contacted DCI to make arrangements for Defendant to appear via Zoom Video Conference for Final PreTrial scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 09:30 am. DCI does not schedule hearings this far in advance. 
Clerk to contact DCI on December 19, 2022 to make arrangements for hearing scheduled January 12, 2023 at 09:30 am. 
Information provided to the parties and reminder added to the Court's calendar.

Defendant Curtis Lidell Chalmers appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt appeared by video for Curtis Lidell Chalmers.  Attorney Francesco Mineo appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for January 12, 2023 at XXX. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant entered a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.
Expires January 30, 2023

Defendant Curtis Lidell Chalmers not in Court, in custody.  Attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt appeared by video for Curtis Lidell Chalmers.  Attorney Francesco Mineo appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant's appearance waived for today's hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:45 pm. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defense contacted the Court regarding Scheduling Conference. Defense is not available. Additionally, the Court is not available. 
NEW DATE: Scheduling Conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm. 
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Curtis Lidell Chalmers appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt appeared by video for Curtis Lidell Chalmers.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of case #12CF5817. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Kunya. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Curtis Lidell Chalmers in court, in custody.  Attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt appeared by video for Curtis Lidell Chalmers.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
FOR BRANCH 46.  Status Conference held.  Attorney Misfeldt accepts appointment.  Order appointing counsel previously signed and filed.  Case adjourned for preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order Appointing Counsel signed and filed.  bm

Defendant Curtis Lidell Chalmers in court.  Attorney Ken Olstinski for Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
FOR BRANCH 46.  Case calendared for State v Lee Hearing.  Public Defenders Office has not appointed counsel as of this date.  Due to the State Public Defender failing to timely appoint counsel, the court appointed counsel at Milwaukee County expense.  Court appoints Attorney Geoffrey Misfeldt who accepts appointment.  Order signed and filed this date.
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT; received and filed.

Defendant Curtis Lidell Chalmers not in court, in custody in HOC.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing. Case to be heard in Br. 12 for Br. 46 on the next date following the defendants lower pending matter 21CF4755.
Hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Speedy Trial.  (Curtis L. Chalmers - #2022008878, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Curtis Lidell Chalmers not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with April T.M.; Terry L.M.;  Aaron S.; and 2300 block of West Clarke Street
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; OVERRIDE for victim witness safety concerns.   If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Curtis Lidell Chalmers in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Curtis Lidell Chalmers in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Curtis Lidell Chalmers appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 5.   Court reserves defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
